result.execSummary:
The defendant Nichole D. Waughtal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Obtain and maintain employment.  Not to be employed where she can be in other people's homes.  Not to clean for anyone except her own family.  They are to present when she cleans, and must be pre-approved by her agent.  Agent must approve her employment.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant to be subject to random drug testing.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person,  or by any other means with the victim, or the facility where she lives.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

timeConds.notes: Sentence to start on or before November 9, 2016 at 6:00 pm.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nichole D. Waughtal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Terrien.  Victim notification complied with.  Defendant plead no contest to the charge.    Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count she plead to.  Defendant understood.  Repeater allegation confirmed by the court.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Theft, movable property, contrary to 948.20(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.  AODA and recommended treatment.  No contact with the victim.  90 days conditional jail.  Obtain and maintain employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  DNA sample and surcharge. 

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  Concurrent with any probation now serving.  AODA and recommended treatment.  No contact with the victim. Not to go to her facility.  Not to clean for anyone except her own family. They are to be present when she cleans, and must be pre-approved by her agent.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Subject to random drug testing.  Serve 90 days conditional jail.  Start on or before 11/9/16 at 6:00 pm.  Obtain and maintain employment.   Not to be employed where she can be in people's home.  Employment to be approved by her agent.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Terrien.  Set for a plea/sentencing.

Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Terrien.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC 8/24 and STC 9/12.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  She just talked to Attorney Poss.  Probably ineligible.  She will still try SPD.  Court advised her to contact SPD immediately.  Other options explained.  AIA set for 8/1 at 9 am.
Nichole called this morning asking to have her case adjourned.  Advised that her appearance was mandatory and she would need to appear. JN

Report for booking.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: M.H.  No unaccompanied access to the home of another.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Report for booking.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: M.H.  No unaccompanied access to the home of another.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  She will contact an attorney.  AIA set for 7/18 at 9 am.
